__comment__: This file was automatically created by mcresources
name: Wild Fruits

pages.text: Many different varieties of wild fruits can be found growing in the world. These can be collected to be eaten, or farmed, with the right equipment. These can be found on different varieties of bushes or trees. In general, fruits can be found in three types of plants: $(l:the_world/wild_fruits#fruit_trees)Fruit Trees$(), $(l:the_world/wild_fruits#tall_bushes)Tall Bushes$(), and $(l:the_world/wild_fruits#small_bushes)Small Bushes$().$(br2)All fruiting plants have a common lifecycle. They will grow, form flowers, sprout fruit, and then lay dormant in a yearly cycle.

Fruit plants are seasonal. During their cold season, these plants will appear brown and lifeless. In the spring, they become green and healthy, getting ready to produce fruit and grow larger. The exact times this happen varies by the fruit. Fruit plants can die, as well: of old age, and of improper climate conditions.

$(thing)Fruit trees$() grow from tiny saplings into large, flowering trees. The branches of fruit trees are their heart, and they will grow as long as the climate conditions are right. As fruit trees mature, they will grow $(thing)leaves$() all around their branches. The leaves can flower and fruit depending on the season.
pages.title: Fruit Trees

pages.text: A typical fruit tree.

Fruit trees start out at $(thing)Saplings$(). Saplings will only start growing, placing their first piece of the tree, if it is not the dormant season for that fruit. The size of the finished tree is loosely determined by how many saplings are in the original sapling block. More saplings means a bigger tree.$(br)More saplings can be added to a single block through $(thing)Splicing$(). To splice a sapling into another, just $(item)$(k:key.use)$() on it while holding a sapling and a $(thing)Knife$() in your off hand.

To get saplings from a fruit tree, break the 'elbow' blocks (branch blocks that are attached to a block on one side and above) tree with an $(thing)Axe$(). Saplings can also be placed on these 'elbow' sections, if they are not too high up in the tree. This allows one fruit tree to grow multiple fruits. Harvesting fruit is done with $(item)$(k:key.use)$() when the leaf block is bearing fruit. This will give one fruit, and revert the plant back to its growing stage, until it goes dormant for the winter.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 100 - 350mm$(br2)Cherry trees grow in the months of January through March, start flowering in April and May, and bear fruit in June.
pages.title: Cherry Tree

pages.text: An example cherry tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 1 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 110 - 280mm$(br2)Green apple trees grow from March to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.
pages.title: Green Apple Tree

pages.text: An example green apple tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 10 - 30 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 180 - 470mm$(br2)Lemon trees grow from February to May, start flowering in June and July, and bear fruit in August.
pages.title: Lemon Tree

pages.text: An example lemon tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 30 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 150 - 500mm$(br2)Olive trees grow from March to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.$(br2)Olives can be used to produce $(l:mechanics/lamps#olives)Olive Oil$(), which can be used as a fuel for lamps.
pages.title: Olive Tree

pages.text: An example olive tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 15 - 36 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 250 - 500mm$(br2)Orange trees grow from March to June, start flowering in July and August, and bear fruit in September.
pages.title: Orange Tree

pages.text: An example orange tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 4 - 27 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 60 - 230mm$(br2)Peach trees grow from December to March, start flowering in April and May, and bear fruit in June.
pages.title: Peach Tree

pages.text: An example peach tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 15 - 31 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 250 - 400mm$(br2)Plum trees grow from January to April, start flowering in May and June, and bear fruit in July.
pages.title: Plum Tree

pages.text: An example plum tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 1 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 100 - 280mm$(br2)Olive trees grow from March to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.
pages.title: Red Apple Tree

pages.text: An example red apple tree.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 17 - 35 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 280 - 500mm$(br2)Bananas are a special kind of fruit tree. They grow only vertically, lack leaves, and only fruit at the topmost block. Saplings are dropped from the flowering part of the plant. Once a banana plant is harvested, it dies, and will not produce any more fruit. It must be replanted in the spring.
pages.title: Banana Tree

pages.text: An example banana tree.

$(thing)Tall Bushes$() are fruit blocks that are able to grow in all directions, and spread. They do this by either growing directly upwards, up to three high, or placing $(thing)canes$() on their sides, which can mature into full bush blocks. After a while, the bushes will stop spreading, and reach maturity. Harvesting these bushes with a sharp tool has a chance to drop a new bush. Bushes that are fully mature will always drop themselves.
pages.title: Tall Bushes

pages.text: A wild tall bush.

Tall bushes are able to spread when their canes have somewhere to take root. Practically, this means that they need a solid block under them to place a new bush on. Providing a flat, open area free of grass or other debris gives them the best chance to grow.

Bushes, unlike fruit trees, take into account surrounding water blocks to determine their $(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(), unlike fruit trees, which only care about rainfall.$(br)Any full bush block can grow berries, which are harvestable with $(item)$(k:key.use)$().

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 7 - 24 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 24 - 100mm$(br2)Blackberry bushes grow from February to May, start flowering in June and July, and bear fruit in August.$(br2)They can be found in areas with few trees.
pages.title: Blackberry Bush

pages.text: An example blackberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 24 - 100mm$(br2)Raspberry bushes grow from April to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.$(br2)They can be found in areas with few trees.
pages.title: Raspberry Bush

pages.text: An example raspberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 7 - 29 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 12 - 100mm$(br2)Blueberry bushes grow from February to May, start flowering in June and July, and bear fruit in August.$(br2)They can be found in areas with few trees.
pages.title: Blueberry Bush

pages.text: An example blueberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 10 - 33 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Rainfall$(): 12 - 100mm$(br2)Elderberry bushes grow from February to May, start flowering in June and July, and bear fruit in August.$(br2)They can be found in areas with few trees.
pages.title: Elderberry Bush

pages.text: An example elderberry bush.

$(thing)Small Bushes$() are a kind of low lying fruit block that spawns in forests. Small bushes occasionally will spread to surrounding blocks, if there aren't too many other bushes nearby.$(br2)Small bushes will go through three sizes, and when grown, they are harvested just with $(item)$(k:key.use)$().
pages.title: Small Bushes

pages.text: Three different sizes of a healthy small bush

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 15 - 35 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 24 - 100 %$(br2)Bunchberry bushes grow from May to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.$(br2)They can be found in forests.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a bunchberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 27 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 24 - 100 %$(br2)Gooseberry bushes grow from April to July, start flowering in August and September, and bear fruit in October.$(br2)They can be found in forests.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a gooseberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): -7 - 18 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 24 - 100 %$(br2)Snowberry bushes grow from March to June, start flowering in July and August, and bear fruit in September.$(br2)They can be found in forests.
pages.title: Snowberry Bush

pages.text: The monthly stages of a snowberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): -2 - 17 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 9 - 100 %$(br2)Cloudberry bushes grow from February to May, start flowering in June to August, and bear fruit in September.$(br2)They can be found in forests.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a cloudberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 28 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 12 - 100 %$(br2)Strawberry bushes grow from October to December, start flowering in January and February, and bear fruit in March.$(br2)They can be found in forests.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a strawberry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): -6 - 17 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 12 - 100 %$(br2)Wintergreen berry bushes grow from May to September, start flowering in October and November, and bear fruit in December.$(br2)They can be found in forests.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a wintergreen berry bush.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): -5 - 17 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:mechanics/hydration)Hydration$(): 30 - 100 %$(br2)Cranberry berry bushes grow from March to June, start flowering in July and August, and bear fruit in September.$(br2)They can be found in forests. Unlike most small bushes, cranberry bushes are grown underwater.

pages.text: The monthly stages of a cranberry berry bush.
